page.title: 01Dial Post The Sussex Weald
page.content: Soil- typical of Sussex Weald mid to heavy loam areas of clay. Enclosed farming land, heavily wooded, oak and ash. 75% grazing-sheep,cattle (milk and beef) 25% arable. Small farm houses in up to 500 acres. Farmers either tenant or owner occupiers. Oil prospecting commencing mid 1980's Inhabitants-near Spear Hill and Dial Post in small 20 cent houses, retired or commuuters Flora - wild daffodils, primroses, bluebells, buttercups,vetch orchids etc Fauna - roe, deer, rabbits, badgers, foxes, many species of birds, resident and migratory. Recreation - fox hunting with the Crawley and Horsham Hunt, shooting grass track racing (twice annualy) feminine interest- riding and gardening. There are two riding school
